summary: This document is a transcript of a videotaped deposition of Jeffrey Epstein taken on March 17, 2010, in the civil case 'Jeffrey Epstein vs. Scott Rothstein, Bradley Edwards and L.M.'. Epstein is questioned by attorney Jack Scarola about his social relationships with various high-profile individuals and repeatedly invokes his Fifth, Sixth, and Fourteenth Amendment rights. The document also includes a header from a separate, earlier deposition of Epstein from October 8, 2009, in the case 'B.B. vs. Jeffrey Epstein'.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein invoked his Fifth, Sixth, and Fourteenth Amendment rights repeatedly during his 2010 deposition to avoid answering questions about socializing with high-profile individuals in the presence of females under the age of 18.

Epstein confirmed social relationships with Donald Trump, Alan Dershowitz, Tommy Mottola, and David Copperfield, but attributed their names being in the lawsuit to an 'abusive discovery process' by the defendants.

The deposition reveals a contentious civil lawsuit where Epstein accused his opposing counsel, Bradley Edwards and Scott Rothstein, of maliciously fabricating cases and trying to 'imperil' his friendships and business relationships.

A separate deposition excerpt from 2009 reveals questioning about a $30 million pledge Epstein allegedly made to Harvard University in 2003, around the time criminal charges were brought against him in Palm Beach.
Epstein identified Alan Dershowitz as both his attorney and a friend, and it was suggested Dershowitz was retained to defend Epstein in the Palm Beach criminal case.
